channel.title: Alex Dunn personal site on
channel.description: Recent content in Alex Dunn personal site on

item.title: Tech-MacGyvering a Raspberry Pi Home Cloud
item.description: TOC: Introduction Step A: Configure SSH Access Step B: Configure automatic backups with crontab and rsync Step C: Easily mount your Pi with SSHFS Step D (optional): Configure access outside the local network Step E (optional): Configure a samba share Maintenance and Conclusions For $35, the Raspberry Pi is an incredible single board computer. You can connect to the internet, run Linux, automate your home, or make a robot - the list goes on and on.

item.title: My CV
item.description: My CV I like data science and scientific computing. (And sometimes both of them together) I’m a Ph.D. candidate in the HackingMaterials group at LBL which works closely alongside the Materials Project. I use computers to help find and design new materials using data science and ab-initio calculations. Github Google Scholar LinkedIn Last updated: 2019-05-27 Formal education B.Sc., Chemical Engineering - UCLA (2014 - 2017) Ph.

item.title: Quotes
item.description: “Viserys says he could sweep the Seven Kingdoms with ten thousand Dothraki screamers.” Ser Jorah snorted. “Viserys could not sweep a stable with ten thousand brooms.”

item.title: Random
item.description: Some random non-work related stuff that doesn’t make sense being in a post. Probably in some state of disrepair. TOC gallery of dslr photos software that’s doing it right Software that’s doing it right (For the most part) Notion - an app for note taking, productivity, writing, and ideas Dark reader - web browsing that’s easier on the eyes fzf - a fuzzy file finder for your terminal emulator or tty dmenu-extended - Similar to fzf but for linux GUIs with dmenu enabled polybar - A status bar for linux Julia - A high performance interpreted language for scientific computing Photos Gallery Some landscape pics I took with a DSLR yuba river, ca
